title: Mt. Blue Criterium
description: The 2015 Blue Hills Classic will once again be run as a criterium, now called The Mt. Blue Crit presented by The Blue Hills Cycling Club. The race will be run as a crit and use the Tuesday night course at Wompatuck. We're sad that we won't be able to use our home course, but the crit course does allow us to offer several more race groups.
course: Closed, paved loop of approximately 1.3 miles
notes:
Please see the map on the registration page for parking, directions, and registration location.  Parking is limited, so please car pool if you can. 

Flat Black Coffee will be on site with both hot and iced coffee beverages, as well as bags of their custom roasted Blue Hills Blend. Make sure you swing by their tent next to registration.

Boston's Baddest Burger and Sandwich Co food truck will also be onsite serving lunch and post race food. Make sure to swing by and grab something. The Hot-Pastra-Me looks ridiculous. More info can be found at http://www.bostonsbaddestburger.com

If fields are not sold out, we will offer day of registration, so bring your friends. 

Landry's Bicycles will be setting up tech support in the wheel pit, but you must bring your own spare wheels. 

ALL RACERS MUST CHECK IN AT LEAST 30 MINUTES BEFORE RACE START TIME.
directions:
Take MA Route 3 to Exit 14 (Route 228) - Follow route 228 East for approximately
3 Â½ miles. Turn right onto Free Street and follow to park entrance (on
right). Drive into the park approximately 2 miles (past Mt Blue Spring) and enter
the next gate on the right. Please park only on the right side of the road
per park regulations.

title: Myles Standish State Forest Road Race
My First Road Bike Camp
description: My First Road Bike Camp:This camp is designed for those who are either recently converted to riding a road bike or those who have some experience and are looking for a structured approach to learning the skills that will make cycling that much more enjoyable. Participants should bring a road bike (with drop bars) and have a basic fitness level that allows them to enjoy rides of 35+ miles over varying terrain.
course: This three-day mini-camp will cover the finer points of road riding. You will learn how to ride in pacelines, echelons and groups. Climbing technique, descending skills and road etiquette will be demystified. Your days will be spent executing specific skills and workouts, and evenings will include short seminars explaining the techniques and goals of each day. You will be introduced to proper bike fit and you'll learn about the essentials of bike maintenance. Most of all, you'll have a great time ensconced in the beautiful sport of cycling in one of the best spots in the world to enjoy it.

title: Two Day Tune Up
description:
Two Day Tune-Up:  This 'two day tune up' will help you develop the finer points of riding a road bicycle.

    Improve your cornering, climbing and descending skills
    Perfect your pedaling technique
    Polish your group riding skills
course: his two day event is designed for those who have a moderate level of experience riding a road bike or those who have more experience and are looking for a structured environment in which to polish the skills that will make them more confident and comfortable in the saddle. Participants should bring a road bike (with drop bars) and be fit enough to enjoy averaging 15 - 17 mph on the flats during rides of 50 miles over terrain that will include some climbing.

title: Root 66 DomnarskiFarm.com 2015
description: One day mtb XC race part of Root 66 Series
course:
It's a great course rain OR shine!!! Trail is a variety of packed singletrack/ ATV and jeep trails and well ridden!  There is even a 0.5 miles pavement.  Bring two tubes, run pressure high to prevent snakebite flats.  Durable equipment and climbing gears highly recommended.  Pre-rides before race day encouraged.

First Timer/Beginner Loop 3.35 miles: http://connect.garmin.com/activity/25346710 Sport thru Pro Loop 10.00 miles:  http://connect.garmin.com/activity/111502491

title: B2VT Ride
description:
In 2001, a small group of elite riders from Team Psycho made the inaugural B2B ride after Harpoon purchased a second brewery in Windsor, VT.  A SAG wagon, armed with water, tires, tubes, and some tools, was the only support.  Upon arriving in Windsor, a keg (well, maybe more than just one keg) was rolled out from the brewery for the post ride celebration.  Since that time, the field of cyclists has grown, the course has been lengthened, and the vertical increased.  The spirit, however, has remained the same: a tough, bare bones ride with the reward of a great party at the finish.

In 2014 a new name (B2VT) and a new course was unveiled by the founders of the B2B. There was a new starting area (Historic Battlefield region of Lexington, Concord and Bedford, MA) and final destination (Okemo Mountain Resort in Ludlow, VT) but the 2014 edition of the B2VT was the most challenging ever! Some new nasty climbs and epic New England roads with an uphill finish at Okemo just added to the legacy!  See the 2015 coursemap here.

The B2VT Ride, though epic, is not for everyone.  It is one of the most challenging bike rides in New England and if you sign up, you are expected to finish within the allotted time frame.  We do not offer sag wagon service to the finish, you must finish on your own except under extreme circumstances (medical emergency). If you do not think you can complete the entire ride, you should not sign up!
course:
Ride starts in Bedford, MA- Spire Corporation 40 Wiggins Avenue, Bedford, MA
There will be ample on-site parking available- see the 2014 Athlete Guide for more information.
Ride ends at Okemo Mountain in Ludlow, VT.

134.3 Miles, 8,101 Feet of climbing including 4 significant climbs:

âThe Primerâ â an irritating little six mile 4% grade climb at mile 30.
âThe Leviathanâ â a long and arduous 5 mile- category 3 climb at mile 75
âThe Shireâ â Classic New England section, starts with a cruise through the Bartonsville covered bridge and then starts a climb up a single lane old wagon road, through the Vermont Village of Bartonsville and through the area woods. Climb is 4 miles in length with a 1 mile section on unpaved hard pack. Epic!
âThe Homestretchâ â not really a single climb but more like having a stone in your shoeâ¦ it starts at mile 110 and then continues with 20 miles of annoying uphill until you arrive in Ludlow, VT

title: Pedal 2 Pints
description:
A Pioneer Valley Bicycle Tour of the Breweries
Visit up to 8 (or 9 TBA) breweries.
A fun ride touring and sampling at the breweries of the Pioneer Valley. Ride along with the brewers and owners while chatting about beer, bikes & life.

There will be bike mechanics from Speed & Sprocket Works on hand at the beginning of the ride for last minute tuning/adjustments as well.  Contact them now for spring tune-ups!
course:
All rides start at Berkshire Brewing Company in South Deerfield.  For the long rides, suggested start time around 9am [check in and breakfast available at 8am]. 
New to 2014, we have added an Easthampton extension.  Visit the new Abandoned Building Brewery and possibly 1-2 of the other new projects.  Southern loop also includes the newly renovated Northampton Brewery, a stop at Valley Malt to learn about this local malter, and Amherst Brewing Company.  Northern portion of the ride(s) include: Artisan Beverage Cooperative (brewers of Katalyst Kombucha, Green River Ambrosia Meads, and Ginger Libation), The People's Pint, and Lefty's Brewing in Greenfield and Element Brewing Company in Millers Falls.  There is also an extension up through Northfield and Bernardston to visit the Four Star Farms hop and barley fields.
registration:
Category	Distance	Start	Fee	Field Limit
45 Mile P2P Ride	45ish miles	12:00 PM	$95	75
33 Mile P2P Ride	33ish miles	12:30 PM	$95	75
90+ Mile P2P Ride	90+ miles	9:00 AM	$95	66
70 mile P2P ride	70ish miles	9:30 AM	$95	75
notes:
Lunch en-route (for long riders) or at start (shorter rides) provided by Chanterelle To Go Farm-to-Table catering

90+ mile (century possible) route: Berkshire Brewing Co. to Northampton to Easthampton to Valley Malt and Amherst; north to Element then through Northfield via Four Star Farms to Bernardston via RT 10 and down into Greenfield to visit Artisan Beverage Coop, Lefty's and The People's Pint.  Return to BBC for BBQ celebration!
70 mile route: As above but skipping the Easthampton Extension, also possible to skip Northfield and go direct to Greenfield from Element Brewing Co.
45 mile route: Just the southern loop.  BBC to Northampton, out to Easthampton and back; east across the river to Valley Malt and Amherst Brewing Co (+optional stop at High Horse brew pub), return through Sunderland to celebration at BBC.
33 mile route: Northern loop.  BBC to Greenfield (3 breweries), over to Element Brewing via Turners Falls, return along the river to BBC celebration.
Also new this year, is the option to PRE-ORDER a VO2max P2P bike jersey ($65 pre-order discount vs. $75 day-of if available).  [Better image here]

All brewers (and some owners) will be riding in the pack as well. If you are a professional brewer interested in joining us for the ride (and perhaps bringing a growlers or two), please contact pedal2pints@gmail.com
Cost includes:            

Marked routes
Tours, samples, and snacks at each brewery.
NEW: P2P musette bag (to carry your lunch/snacks for short loop riders)
Breakfast/road snacks, lunch on the go, BBQ dinner and pints.
A commemorative P2P pint glass.
Donations to MassBike and other bike advocacy groups.
 An entire day to ride and chat with some of the best brewers in the Valley!
   

    No Sag support provided -- bring your own extra tubes, tools, tires, and pump.

POST-RIDE MASSAGE available from Marly Shaffer massage.

    Must be 21+ to drink alcohol.

Additional dinners are available for friends and family meeting participants at the end of the ride.
directions:
https://www.google.com/maps?q=42.4785451,-72.6102884
Get directions to Berkshire Brewing Company here.

title: Northeastern's Wild Western Mass MTB Weekend
QuadCross 2015
description: Quadcross is back for its 9th year. One of the best early season races. All proceeds donated to fight Pancreatic Cancer. www.pan-can.org
course: Start with a lap around the ball field, then a bit past the rifle ranges, up the road, past the pit, gravel road past the cell tower, left down a hill into the woods, twisty bit throught the woods, over a hill, more woods, 180 degree left turn onto the long gravel road, long straight grinding climb, around the edge of the parking lot, 180 in the volley ball court, loop in front of the pavilion,  back behind the pavillion, over the barriers and back to the start. Much like last year.
registration:
Please register online http://www.BikeReg.com/quadcross-2015
some events will fill quickly, $5 additional for day of reg.
notes: Classic early season grass roots Cyclocross race.
directions:
Take exit 29 from route 95 Route 2 west for 6.3 miles
Left onto route 62 for 4.2 miles
Left onto Waltham St for .5 miles
Left onto Old MIll Road, follow to the end .2 miles
